Research Teaching Service CV Gallery

Alexander N. Wilson

Research

I am primarily interested in algebraic combinatorics, which aims to answer questions about algebraic structures through the use of combinatorial objects like graphs or tableaux. In particular, I apply these techniques to the area of representation theory.

  • UW Milwaukee Colloquium Feb 14, 2025: Symmetries and Diagram Algebras [slides]
  • UW Madison Combinatorics Seminar Jan 27, 2025: The Structure of Weyl Alternation Sets [slides]

  • SSMC Jun 6, 2024: Crystal Structures on Bitableaux (20min survey talk) [slides]
  • GOCC Feb 15, 2023: A Diagram-Like Basis for the Multiset Partition Algebra [video] [slides]
  • JMM Jan 5, 2023: A Diagram-Like Basis for the Multiset Partition Algebra [slides]
